title: Plz contact me Riot
body:
To whom it may concern,

Since I am not allowed to under your rules to "Naming and Shaming" to post that "Posts that accuse others of causing a negative in-game experience". 

I would like for you to contact me so that I can report a player for writing to another player that his/her **mother should die**. We all reported it, but I have to be honest and inform you that I would like to receive a personal notification on this one as I believe this goes against all that Riot stands for. I understand you receive notifications from us players who are appreciating what the game should be about and are enjoying it that way. However, there are those who take the liberty to troll the game and spew toxic language around them. Please take action.

Yours sincerely,
Loreshaper

replies.body:
If you reported the person after the game, that is all that is needed.

> I would like to receive a personal notification on this one

We do not give personal notifications as to how we handle other peoples' accounts.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/PzY1ArN3-we-dont-ban-people-for-asking-for-reports

Hey Tantrum, there's a post that was discussed a bunch yesterday which contradicts things which you have said in the recent past, might be worth your attention. 

Sorry for hijacking this thread to bring your attention to it.
What exactly was contradicted?

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/PzY1ArN3-we-dont-ban-people-for-asking-for-reports?sort_type=best&comment=000b

Do people get punished for report begging or not? We now have contradictory information on the matter which i sum up in in the linked post. We can continue discussing there if you're interested as that discussion probably doesn't belong in this unrelated thread.

I won't speak for Tantram, but asking for reports as a sole factor doesn't appear to be enough to trigger the IFS to punish outright; however, for some of these people who use "report x for y" to harrass other players, they actually exhibit toxicity beyond this as well, thus yielding punishments.
If that's how it works, fine i guess w/e, but that's not how it was explained in the past. Hence the contradiction.

That post can be a little confusing.

The post was made to address confusion players had, thinking that asking for reports was akin to hate speech / zero tolerance and directly resulted in a ban. This is not true. But, asking for reports CAN be a way of harassing players. In that case, the system can detect that you are using it as a means of harassment. A single 'report xx' isn't going to cause a penalty. But calling someone a feeder for having a poor game, telling people to report them for int'ing, etc .. is all going to be considered negative.

Riot doesn't define what is acceptable/unacceptable. It is the player base that decides that. Our systems learn from our players. Just like how players taught the system that GGEZ is pretty BM, players also taught the system that 'report xxx for int'ing' when they are not, is also negative.

I admit that the recent post was rather confusing.

Ok here's the issue as I see it;

* People are asking one question; Is asking for reports a punishable offense?

The answer may be either **A) Yes it is**, *B) No it isn't*, or ***C) Kind of, because when they are being negative by calling them a feeder and saying to report it's harassment***.

The answer you have given here is, imo, basically answer ***C***. However, that seems to be entirely dependent on the accusations being made, so it sounds like *even then* lobbying for reports isn't punishable, it's just the part about making accusations and shaming.

If that is the case, then don't say "lobbying for reports is punishable", leave that out of it entirely. Say only what's relevant, that *shaming and making accusations to influence reports is punishable*.

If you disagree with how I've broken down the possible responses or misinterpreted what your answer meant, I feel it's important that they are broken down step by step to be clarified.

---

> thinking that asking for reports was akin to hate speech / zero tolerance

I'm sorry, where did you see this?

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=1NGnychF,comment-id=00010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-29T22:13:29.224+0000)
>
> I'm sorry, where did you see this?

Surely thou jests.

It is INCREDIBLY common for people in-game and sometimes in-boards to say "Calling for reports is a bannable offense".
The same as hate speech? Absolutely not. I have never seen anyone suggest they are treated the same.

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=1NGnychF,comment-id=0001000000000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2017-03-30T05:00:41.732+0000)
>
> The same as hate speech? Absolutely not.

What you consider it is irrelevant. What matters to the player base is "Can I get banned for this".

Your argument falters.

> What you consider it is irrelevant.

It's relevant because that (whether any players consider it the same ) is the point I am addressing...

There is a person on the Boards who posts both frequently and vocally here in PB&M regarding how unfair and inconsistent Riot's policies are with regards to enforcing punishment.  They have complained many times that the system is somewhat ridiculous in that a player can be banned just as easily for calling for reports as they can be for hate speech.  They are referring specifically to how when a player is at Punishment Tier 3, even a relatively "minor" infraction can result in a permanent suspension, making it, in their argument, akin to hate speech.  From what I've seen, most of the times it's been said, someone has stepped in and contradicted it immediately, but the fact that it is being said so often likely was causing quite a bit of confusion.

> [{quoted}](name=VentressRedeemed,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=1NGnychF,comment-id=000100000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-30T00:06:04.542+0000)
>
> There is a person on the Boards who posts both frequently and vocally here in PB&M regarding how unfair and inconsistent Riot's policies are with regards to enforcing punishment.  

... am I being referenced?!

Surely you noticed that I deliberately refrained from mentioning any names, or indeed from giving any details specific enough to allow someone to be able to identify the player being referenced.  That was again, deliberate, as it would be incredibly rude to hold any manner of discussion regarding another player without them being present to speak for themselves on the matter.  More pointedly, the identity of the player is somewhat irrelevant to the discussion, with only their posting regarding how calling for reports was akin to hate speech/zero tolerance being pertinent.  Nami was curious as to where that had been seen.  I answered.  

That being said, since you are here and asking, I will say that no, I am not referring to you.

If someone does it constantly in the same match, that would be considered harassment I'm pretty sure. I'm glad they don't just treat it like it's black and white. Gotta take these things on a case by case basis and use common sense to tell whether it's negative, or a legitimate concern of a player hoping more people report because someone broke the rules. I'd say in most cases, calling more than twice would be considered harassment. *Most* cases.

> 
> I admit that the recent post was rather confusing.

Actually really glad for that clarification.

Found it kind of frustrating when you had an afk that wasn't straight obvious afk to enemy team.

EG: Having a Teemo that starts putting mushrooms in useless places (like inside spawn pool), and spamming /L every time you die/recall, because he's 'done'.
Enemy team can possibly not even notice that at all, as some of his old mushrooms, (pre-trolling/afking phase) are still out there and they might bump into those for quite a while after the Teemo stopped being actively useful for the team.

I know 'one report is enough.' But sometimes it just feels better to let enemy know that it was a 4v5, and they can stop gloating now....

The community overall as a whole believes 'report calling / lobbying for mass reports' _is a form of harassment_, though. There is literally **zero justification to ever lobby reports against someone**.

> Riot Tantram (NA) 2 months ago in > Permabanned for saying "..."
> [. . .] Asking for reports is considered harassment by the community. [. . .]

Sure, in your case it was _obvious_ that the teemo was afk/trolling/griefing in your game, but that isn't always the case.

Also, even that being said (about the teemo) -- lobbying for reports still could result in more passive-aggressive griefing, or harassment, or any other number of toxic chat related negativity _simply because players' focus is shifted onto that player's bad behavior through chat_.

Or if enemy is siege/starving us, when they could clearly just end, and being rude in chat, or spamming mastery emotes and whatnot. I might say 'Guys it's 4v5, Teemo is standing in spawn spamming mushrooms, please end and report him.'

Post game, sure. No biggy. I mean, more reports aren't going _to do anything_, since all you need is your one report to flag them and get the game/chat reviewed. But yea, post game is more acceptable since it's not directly negatively influencing the game as it happens.

Everything you're saying are reportable offenses; what I'm saying is _there's no need to **lobby mass reports on anyone, ever**. _You only need one report_.

Yeh, I know you only need 1. It's more about feels.
Like would you rather have the 20/0/10 enemy Zed be like 'I FKED U GUIZ SO HARD LOLOLO'
Or be like 'sry about 4v5, will report Teemo'

I mean..yeh, most likely if enemy is gonna BM, they are going to BM regardless. But every once and a while I've had someone change their tone when they find out it was a 4v5...
It's kinda nice, and makes a 4v5 way less tilting for your next game.
